intro: Heteroneuron repandum, commonly known as the common bluebell, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is characterized by its striking blue or purple bell-shaped flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream sides. The flowers are pollinated primarily by bees and other insects, contributing to its ecological importance in supporting local pollinator populations.
